messages.content: Two years ago you elected me as your MP and I’ve been working for you here and in London since then. I voted against Brexit, against Trident, and against Tory austerity. I’ve made the case for fair pensions, investment in public services, the rights of EU citizens post-Brexit and support for our creative communities. I’ve pursued environmental issues (including EU protections) and the Tories’ appalling treatment of disabled people.

I don’t like Theresa May’s Government, it’s cruel to so many people and the Brexit mess is alarming. The only effective opposition has been the SNP and we’re needed more than ever. Jeremy Corbyn is a decent man but his party has done him down to the point where he can’t operate properly. He’s been betrayed by his own side and his credibility is destroyed. That infighting and squabbling has damaged Labour so much it can’t compete at all.

The Tories look like they’ll win most of the seats in England so Theresa May will be back as Prime Minister. That means more Tory cuts, less support for the poor, more confusion over Brexit, more attacks on renewable energy, and an end to pension protections. It’s more important than ever to have strong voices speaking up for Scotland; more important than ever to have the SNP opposing the Tories and protecting Scotland.

It’s a contest between the SNP and the Tories here in Edinburgh North and Leith. Give me your trust and your support again, give me your vote and send me back to London to carry on with the job. Vote Brock on June 8th.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Voted against Brexit and supports the rights of EU citizens post-Brexit.
Pursued environmental issues, including EU protections.
Opposes the Tories' treatment of disabled people.
